message.content:
cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.LO, cs.CG, cs.DS 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) - The paper deals with a combinatorial problem of tiling a two-dimensional grid with given patterns, which falls under the scope of discrete mathematics. 
2. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper discusses the complexity of the tiling problem and presents an algorithm to determine if the given patterns admit at least one coloring of the grid, which is related to computational complexity. 
3. cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) - The paper uses standard arguments and logical reasoning to prove the main result of the existence of a periodic coloring if a coloring with legal patterns exists. 
4. cs.CG (Computational Geometry) - The paper considers the tiling problem with different convex shapes in place of the rectangle, which is related to computational geometry. 
5. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper presents an algorithm to determine if the given patterns admit at least one coloring of the grid, which is related to data structures and algorithms.
